get.description: This interface can obtain the latest news announcements, and the default page search is for announcements within a month.

parameters.name: annType
parameters.description: Announcement types: latest-announcements , activities (latest activities), new-listings (new currency online), product-updates (product updates), vip (institutions and VIPs), maintenance-updates (system maintenance), product -updates (product news), delistings (currency offline), others, api-campaigns (API user activities), default : latest-announcements

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: Language type, the default is en_US, the specific value parameters are as follows

cTime.description: Announcement release time, Unix millisecond timestamp format

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface can obtain the latest news announcements, and the default page search is for announcements within a month.

get.description: Request via this endpoint to get the currency details of a specified currency

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: Support for querying the chain of currency, e.g. The available value for USDT are OMNI, ERC20, TRC20. This only apply for multi-chain currency, and there is no need for single chain currency.

currency.description: A unique currency code that will never change

name.description: Currency name, will change after renaming

fullName.description: Full name of a currency, will change after renaming

preConfirms.description: The number of blocks (confirmations) for advance on-chain verification

withdrawPrecision.description: Withdrawal precision bit, indicating the maximum supported length after the decimal point of the withdrawal amount

maxDeposit.description: Maximum amount of single deposit (only applicable to Lightning Network)

get.description: Request via this endpoint to get detail currency pairs for trading. If you want to get the market information of the trading symbol, please use Get All Tickers.

symbol.description: unique code of a symbol, it would not change after renaming

name.description: Name of trading pairs, it would change after renaming

baseMinSize.description: The minimum order quantity requried to place an order.

quoteMinSize.description: The minimum order funds required to place a market order.

baseMaxSize.description: The maximum order size required to place an order.

quoteMaxSize.description: The maximum order funds required to place a market order.

baseIncrement.description: Quantity increment: The quantity for an order must be a positive integer multiple of this increment. Here, the size refers to the quantity of the base currency for the order. For example, for the ETH-USDT trading pair, if the baseIncrement is 0.0000001, the order quantity can be 1.0000001 but not 1.00000001.

quoteIncrement.description: Quote increment: The funds for a market order must be a positive integer multiple of this increment. The funds refer to the quote currency amount. For example, for the ETH-USDT trading pair, if the quoteIncrement is 0.000001, the amount of USDT for the order can be 3000.000001 but not 3000.0000001.

priceIncrement.description: Price increment: The price of an order must be a positive integer multiple of this increment. For example, for the ETH-USDT trading pair, if the priceIncrement is 0.01, the order price can be 3000.01 but not 3000.001.

makerFeeCoefficient.description: The maker fee coefficient. The actual fee needs to be multiplied by this coefficient to get the final fee. Most currencies have a coefficient of 1. If set to 0, it means no fee

takerFeeCoefficient.description: The taker fee coefficient. The actual fee needs to be multiplied by this coefficient to get the final fee. Most currencies have a coefficient of 1. If set to 0, it means no fee

post.description: Place order to the Spot trading system, you can place two major types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system,which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

clientOid.description: The user self-defined order id.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Place order to the Spot trading system, you can place two major types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

clientOid.description:
Client Order IdThe ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the userwe recommend using a UUID, and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores _, and hyphens -. This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

side.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

type.description:
specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price, you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

remark.description: Order placement remarks, length cannot exceed 20 characters (ASCII)

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into four strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

price.description:
Specify price for order

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order

When **type** is limit, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. Teh Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

timeInForce.description: [Time in force](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is a special strategy used during trading

postOnly.description: passive order labels, this is disabled when the order timing strategy is IOC or FOK

hidden.description: [Hidden order](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) or not (not shown in order book)

iceberg.description: Whether or not only visible portions of orders are shown in [Iceberg orders](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146)

visibleSize.description: Maximum visible quantity in iceberg orders

tags.description: Order tag, length cannot exceed 20 characters (ASCII)

cancelAfter.description: Cancel after n secondsthe order timing strategy is GTT

funds.description: When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

delete.description: This endpoint can cancel all spot orders for specific symbol. This endpoint only sends cancellation requests. The results of the requests must be obtained by checking the order status or subscribing to websocket.
delete.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can cancel all spot orders for specific symbol. This endpoint only sends cancellation requests. The results of the requests must be obtained by checking the order status or subscribing to websocket.

post.description: Place order to the spot trading system  The difference between this interface and "Add order" is that this interface will synchronously return the order information after the order matching is completed.  For higher latency requirements, please select the "Add order" interface. If there is a requirement for returning data integrity, please select this interface

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system,which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

clientOid.description: The user self-defined order id.

status.description: Order Status. openorder is active; doneorder has been completed

post.description: Place stop order to the Spot trading system, you can place two major types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system,which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

clientOid.description: The user self-defined order id.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Place stop order to the Spot trading system, you can place two major types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

clientOid.description:
Client Order IdThe ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the userwe recommend using a UUID, and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores _, and hyphens -. This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

side.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

type.description:
specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price, you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

remark.description: Order placement remarks, length cannot exceed 20 characters (ASCII)

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into four strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

price.description:
Specify price for order, not need for market order.

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order

When **type** is limit, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. Teh Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

timeInForce.description: [Time in force](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is a special strategy used during trading. Required for limit orders.

postOnly.description: passive order labels, this is disabled when the order timing strategy is IOC or FOK if **type** is limit.

hidden.description: [Hidden order](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) or not (not shown in order book)

iceberg.description: Whether or not only visible portions of orders are shown in [Iceberg orders](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146)

visibleSize.description: When **type** is limit, this is Maximum visible quantity in iceberg orders.

cancelAfter.description: Cancel after n secondsthe order timing strategy is GTT when **type** is limit.

funds.description: When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

tradeType.description: The type of trading : TRADESpot, MARGIN_TRADE (Cross Margin), MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE (Isolated Margin). Default is TRADE

post.description: Place order to the Spot trading system, you can place two major types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system,which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Place order to the Spot trading system, you can place two major types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

clientOid.description:
Client Order IdThe ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the userwe recommend using a UUID, and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores _, and hyphens -. This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

side.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

type.description:
specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price, you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

remark.description: Order placement remarks, length cannot exceed 20 characters (ASCII)

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into four strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

price.description:
Specify price for order

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order

When **type** is limit, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. Teh Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

timeInForce.description: [Time in force](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is a special strategy used during trading

postOnly.description: passive order labels, this is disabled when the order timing strategy is IOC or FOK

hidden.description: Hidden or not (not shown in order book)

iceberg.description: Whether or not only visible portions of orders are shown in iceberg orders

visibleSize.description: Maximum visible quantity in iceberg orders

cancelAfter.description: Cancel after n secondsthe order timing strategy is GTT

funds.description: When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

tradeType.description: The type of trading : **TRADE**Spot Trade, **MARGIN_TRADE** (Margin Trade). Default is **TRADE**. **Note: To improve the system performance and to accelerate order placing and processing, KuCoin has added a new interface for order placing of margin. For traders still using the current interface, please move to the new one as soon as possible. The current one will no longer accept margin orders by May 1st, 2021 (UTC). At the time, KuCoin will notify users via the announcement, please pay attention to it.**

get.description: Request via this endpoint to get the recent fills. The return value is the data after Pagination, sorted in descending order according to time.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system (If orderId is specifiedplease ignore the other query parameters)

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: The type of trading:TRADE - Spot Trading(TRADE as default), MARGIN_TRADE - Cross Margin Trading, MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE - Isolated Margin Trading.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per request. Minimum is 10, maximum is 500.

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

side.description: Buy or sell

feeCurrency.description: currency used to calculate trading fee

stop.description: Take Profit and Stop Loss type, currently HFT does not support the Take Profit and Stop Loss type, so it is empty

type.description: Specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order.

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request via this endpoint to get the recent fills. The return value is the data after Pagination, sorted in descending order according to time.
